isis.stitle: SINGLE REDUCTION CARRIERS: ROCKWELL - REASSEMBLE - ROTATING RESISTANCE CHECK OF DIFFERENTIAL GEARS

svcproc.title: ROTATING RESISTANCE CHECK OF DIFFERENTIAL GEARS

figure.caption: Figure 95. Make Tool For Checking Rotating Resistance

step1.para: Install soft metal covers over vise jaws to protect the ring gear ( Figure 96).

figure.caption: Figure 96. Install Soft Metal Covers Over Vise Jaws

step1.para: Put the differential and ring gear assembly in the vise.
Install the tool into the differential until the splines of the tool and one side gear are engaged ( Figure 96).
Attach a torque wrench to the nut of the tool and rotate the differential gears. As the differential gears rotate, read the value indicated on the torque wrench ( Figure 97).

figure.caption: Figure 97. Attach Torque Wrench to Nut of Tool and Rotate Differential Gears

step1.para: If the torque value exceeds 50 ft-lbs. (67.8 N·m) torque maximum applied to one side gear, disassemble the differential gears from the case halves.
Check the case halves, spider, gears and thrust washers for the problem that causes the torque value to exceed the specification. Repair or replace parts.
After the parts are repaired or replaced, assemble parts and repeat Steps 1 to 6.
